content:
When you click on someone's name in the right sidebar, it shows you PMs with them. I feel like this is often not what I want; I either want all the messages they have sent (if I'm trying to figure out who they are), or PMs + Group PMs.
The "all messages" thing I'm willing to believe is unusual, and applies mainly to admins. The PMs + Group PMs seems like maybe a better default behavior?

hm, I just noticed one argument against changing it, which is that if it is just PMs, we can open the compose box.
Maybe a new proposal is just to change the text at
pasted image
to say "See all messages sent by Tim Abbott.", or "See [Group PMs] including or [all messages] sent by Tim Abbott."
The other reasonable optionn is we could just have it open the user profile popover, and then you can pick which option you want.

I'm working on this issue and I'want to confirm what we want to try out: On clicking any username in right sidebar should open the user popover as it opens on clicking "down chevron/arrow" and the old behavior can be reached by clicking "View Private Messages" in the popover.
I guess an unrelated thing to do is add "View group private messages" to the popover.
Just to be clear, this will eliminate the chevrons, correct?

this is getting complicated from a UX perspective, but I feel like at least for me the following algorithm would be basically 100% correct:

  • If I have a PM with that person, give me PMs
  • else if I have a group PM, give me that
  • else give me all messages.

And I'm not sure I'll be excited about the second click for getting the PMs. But I think reasonable to try it out and see how it feels.
Yeah, I think we should probably go with showing the popover (removing the chevron), and iterate from there.

Yeah, I think we should probably go with showing the popover (removing the chevron), and iterate from there.

I've created a PR. #7246 which implements above demands. I will iterate from here according to feedback.

I'm excited to try this out! Plus, I like how it reduces code. :smile_cat:
